archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Virginia O'Neill was an architect in Stamford, Connecticut in the 1950's. The collection includes educational certificates, drawings, and plans for several residential projects.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Virginia O'Neill Architectural Collection must be obtained from the Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Virginia O'Neill Architectural Colection, Ms2006-010, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Virginia O'Neill Architectural Colelction was donated to the International Archive of Women in Architecture at the Special Collections in 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement and description of the Virginia O'Neill Architectural Collection took place in May 2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Virginia Brown O'Neill was born in 1923 in Stamford, Connecticut. She was an architect in the 1950's to the 1960's in Connecticut. Little is known about her projects. She retired to St. Petersburg, Florida and died in August 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Virginia O'Neill architectural collection consists of personal materials and plans for several residential projects. Personal information includes a diploma from Stamford High School and two artistic drawings. Residential projects include architectural plans for several residential projects, including the Sawmill House, a six-room house and a vacation home in a hexagonal plan.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged chronologically by material type.

did.unittitle: 2 Pencil sketch drawings, a girl and a solider, 1944
Unidentified preliminary residential plans, 5 sets of sketches n.d.
Arrowhead House blueprints, 6 sheets of plans, details, and elevations, 1955
Sawmill House, version 1 blueprints, 4 sheets including elevations, framing plan and foundation plan, 1957
Windmill House preliminary drawings, 6 sheets including plans, elevations, sections and details, 1957
Six Room House, 8 sheets including plans, elevations, sections and details, 1958
Windmill House diazotype job prints, 10 sheets including landscape plan, plans, elevations, sections and details, 1959
Vacation House/Hexagonal plan diazotypes, 10 sheets including elevations, sections, details and electrical plan, 1963
Vacation House/Hexagonal plan tracings, 10 sheets including elevations, sections, details and electrical plan, 1963
